Detailed Description

An abstract factory for languages definitions.

A factory for color definitinos. You can load this class with a file and then query for a specific color role, and then get the color definition

See also:
QsvColorDef

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

QsvColorDefFactory::QsvColorDefFactory (   ) 
 

default constructor

Builds the factory, without any color definitions. You can load colors by calling load() later on.

QsvColorDefFactory::QsvColorDefFactory (  QDomDocument  doc  ) 
 

constructs a color factory with a document

Parameters:
doc the document from which the color definitions should be loaded
Builds the factory, without and loading the definitions from the DOM document passed as the parameter.

QsvColorDefFactory::QsvColorDefFactory (  QString  fileName  ) 
 

constructs a color factory with a document

Parameters:
fileName the file from which the color definitions should be loaded
Builds the factory, without and loading the definitions from the xml file passed as the parameter.

QsvColorDefFactory::~QsvColorDefFactory (   )  [virtual]
 

default destructor

Kills this object. Does nothing but have an interface for derived classes.

Member Function Documentation

QsvColorDef QsvColorDefFactory::getColorDef (  QString  name  ) 
 

query the factory and return a color definition

Parameters:
name the color class to match
Returns:
the color definition which matches the input
When constructing this class, you will ask it to loads all the color definitions from an XML file Then you will generally ask for the color of the class "string" or something similar.

This factory does not care about the names, and they should match the names found on the color and syntax files definitions.

See also:
load( QDomDocument )

QsvColorDef

QsvColorDef::getStyleNum()

bool QsvColorDefFactory::load (  QString  fileName  ) 
 

load color definitions from a QDomDocument

Returns:
true on succes, false on ay error
Loads the color definitions from an external XML file. This is a convenience overloaded function which behaves like the above function.

See also:
load( QDomNode )

bool QsvColorDefFactory::load (  QDomDocument  doc  ) 
 

load color definitions from a QDomDocument

Returns:
true on succes, false on ay error
Loads the color definitions from a QDomDocument. The document should consist of single root elemment called (tag name) "itemDatas" and a list of elements called "itemData". The attributes of the node will represent the values of the color defintion.

For more details look at QsvColorDef::load( QDomNode node )

See also:
QsvColorDef::load( QDomNode node )

load( QString )
